content:
• Chemical reactions involve the formation of new substances
• Four main types: combination, decomposition, displacement, double displacement
• Combination reactions: A + B → AB
• Decomposition reactions: AB → A + B
• Displacement: A + BC → AC + B
• Double displacement: AB + CD → AD + CB
• Energy changes occur during reactions
• Catalysts can speed up reactions

• Chemical reactions involve the formation of new substances with different properties
• Four main types: combination, decomposition, displacement, double displacement
• Combination reactions: A + B → AB (synthesis)
• Decomposition reactions: AB → A + B (analysis)
• Displacement: A + BC → AC + B (single replacement)
• Double displacement: AB + CD → AD + CB (double replacement)
• Energy changes occur during reactions (exothermic/endothermic)
• Catalysts can speed up reactions without being consumed
• Law of conservation of mass applies to all reactions
